item.title: Missionary Age Change
item.description: What effects did the missionary age change have? Find out how BYU-Idaho turned an unexpected change into an advantage.

item.title: Drenched in Gratitude
item.description: "Gratitude is the great antidote, the great protection against the spirit of entitlement..." Kim B. Clark, President of BYU-Idaho.

item.title: Construction Photo Gallery
item.description: Through winter snow and summer floods, BYU-Idaho has continued to grow by building better, more efficient buildings and walkways.

item.title: Beauty Found at BYU-Idaho
item.description: There are many elements that make BYU-Idaho campus beautiful. Whether it is a cheerful spring morning or a brisk winter evening, there are always gorgeous views on campus for visitors, students, employees and alumni to enjoy.

item.title: Building Spotlight: The Jacob Spori Building
item.description: Originally built in 1903, the Spori Building was destroyed by fire in November 2000. The building that we see today was rebuilt and dedicated in the summer of 2003.

item.title: Sacred Music Highlight
item.description: Watch and listen to the story of the Sacred Music Series and what it has been doing for composers, students and audiences since 1989.

item.title: How Great You Are
item.description: This July 15, 2014 devotional from Dana Johnson revels how to overcome self-doubt and focuses on self-worth.

item.title: Recent Construction at BYU-Idaho
item.description: BYU-Idaho campus is being expanded and updated to make sure BYU-Idaho students are accommodated and cared for while on campus. A few of the recent additions in the past year include a redesigned and renovated Taylor Quad with a water feature and Central Quad with an amphitheater addition.

item.title: Becoming Mighty Oaks
item.description: View photos of the recent graduates who are "becoming the mighty oaks" President Jacob Spori promised about those who attend BYU-Idaho.

item.title: A Glimpse Into Pathway
item.description: Pathway is a guided education process that helps students around the world ease into higher education. In this gallery are photos of students in the Pathway program from Pueblo, Mexico; Boston, Massachusetts and Riverside, California.

item.title: Student Activities
item.description: The Student Activities Program provides students numerous opportunities to get involved, develop leadership and mentoring abilities, and serve others. A variety of year-round activities are offered in eight core areas: life skills, outdoor, service, social, competitive sports, recreation sports, talent and wellness.

item.title: Rocket Team
item.description: Discover how an idea ignited and became the little rocket that could.

item.title: Enrollment Growth Statistics
item.description: See where BYU-Idaho students are from, their majors, and more.

item.title: Campus Capers
item.description: Learn how The Career Networking Center can help you find your major or prepare for post-grad life.

item.title: Frugality and Thrifty Living
item.description: Find out how BYU-Idaho is sustaining energy and utilizing resources.

item.title: Backstage Pass
item.description: Learn the ins and outs of devotional with your VIP backstage pass.

item.title: Mastering Graduate School
item.description: Learn about programs for doctorate and masters degrees.

item.title: Education Online through BYU-Idaho
item.description: Learn about the quality and flexibility of online learning.

item.title: Ricks College Athletics
item.description: Go! Fight! Win! A historical glance at BYU-Idaho’s sporting events.

item.title: On Track with Pathway
item.description: A way for students to get on the path toward a higher education.

item.title: Competitive Sports
item.description: Get a front row seat at some of BYU-Idaho’s competitive sports offered through the Student Activities Program.

item.title: Winter 2014 Graduation
item.description: The Winter 2014 graduates celebrate a big milestone with family and friends.

item.title: Sustained Recycling
item.description: Learn how BYU-Idaho and Rexburg are reducing waste while creating jobs.

item.title: Seek Learning by Study & Faith
item.description: Learn how BYU-Idaho innovates academically while keeping the pioneer spirit of faith and discipleship that has upheld it since 1888.

item.title: Devotional Highlights
item.description: Every Tuesday afternoon, students and employees assemble in the BYU-Idaho Center for devotional. They come to hear words of counsel and inspiration from a variety of specially selected speakers.

item.title: Personal Honor
item.description: See personal honor through the eyes of one BYU-Idaho athlete participating in competitive sports. A wide variety of athletics are offered through the Student Activities Program.

item.title: A Real Student
item.description: Devey is a fun-loving nursing student, has some mean skills in the kitchen, and calls Spokane, Washington home. She's also a real student at BYU-Idaho; let her tell you what that means to her.

item.title: Past Presidents
item.description: Take a quick trip down BYU-Idaho's memory lane to glimpse the principals and presidents who have led the institution and contributed to its legacy.

item.title: A Student's Perspective
item.description: Watch a short clip about one of our students and find out what being a real BYU-Idaho student means to him.

item.title: Autumn Splendor
item.description: Enjoy a virtual stroll through BYU-Idaho's campus dappled in the colors of fall.

item.title: Constitution Day
item.description: The BYU-Idaho community remembers the freedoms afforded by the nation's Constitution in this 2013 commemoration.

item.title: Spring 2013 Graduation
item.description: The university awarded 685 associate degrees and 1,085 bachelor's degrees. Of the graduates, 1,089 were females and 804 males.

item.title: Changing Moments
item.description: Meagan is an avid writer, works for a publication in Washington and grew up in Houston, Texas. She's also a real student at BYU-Idaho; find out what she loves about it.

item.title: Meet Skylar Onken
item.description: Meet Skylar Onken

item.title: Design Thinking
item.description: Get your creative juices flowing with design thinking. It's all the rage in business and on campus. This infographic features the new Design Thinking cluster offered by BYU-Idaho.

item.title: Legacy Moments Yesterday
item.description: Read about the growth of BYU-Idaho of when doing good things to accomplished something great.

item.title: Legacy Moments Today
item.description: Discover modern examples of those who are part of BYU-Idaho's legacy today.

item.title: Pathway to Success
item.description: Arkadiusz is a Pathway student and branch president living in Brockton, Massachusetts. As a Pathway student, Arkadiusz understands that receiving a spiritual education is just as important as a higher education.

item.title: Building Zion
item.description: See how Student Living principles enhance the BYU-Idaho experience and help build Zion at home.

item.title: Inspired Leadership
item.description: At their inaugurations, three BYU-Idaho presidents similarly envision the school's educational reach.

item.title: Devotional Rewind
item.description: Enjoy this 1998 devotional by Susan Easton Black on following the Savior's example of service.

item.title: Something for Everyone
item.description: BYU-Idaho Student Activities is the largest student-run organization on campus. Students can participate and lead various activities including: life skills, outdoor, service, social, competitive sports, recreational sports, talent and wellness.

item.title: Pathway in Ghana
item.description: Watch Adeola's experience with Pathway and how it changed his life.

item.title: Love at Home
item.description: Student Living sets the stage for a new culture to emerge within apartment life - a culture based on principles of love, shared responsibility, and mutual respect.

item.title: Give More Lemons
item.description: Laugh with the Lemons as they share how prayers were answered by Pathway and Online Learning.

item.title: Campus Beauty
item.description: No matter the season, BYU-Idaho's campus is home to beauty of all kinds.

item.title: Let's Get Technical
item.description: Step inside the Mark Austin Technical and Engineering Building, home of the College of Physical Sciences and Engineering, and see students engaged in multiple hands-on learning experiences.

item.title: Academic Highlights
item.description: Students are prepared for lifelong learning, employment, and their roles as a citizens and parents through their opportunities at BYU-Idaho. Students are able to quite literally take their education into their own hands.

item.title: The Performing Arts
item.description: Attending alumni, students, staff, and community members are uplifted and entertained by performances from BYU-Idaho students. Catch a glimpse of the dedication and passion students bring to the stage.

item.title: Graduation Fall 2012
item.description: The success of achieving a diploma doesn't stop here for promising BYU-Idaho grads. With invaluable lessons learned in academics, personal spirituality, and recreation, there is no doubt that BYU-Idaho graduates go on to do great things in their families and in the world.

item.title: Events at Education Week
item.description: BYU-Idaho Education Week, held August 1-3, is a campus-wide event for the public. Class topics range from "Date Night Dancing" to "Learing by the Spirit." Take a peek at a few photos from past Education Week events.

item.title: Campus Activity Highlights
item.description: Activities such as cross country skiing, pond skimming, I-Cover, and pie eating contests provide unique opportunities for students to be actively involved in the BYU-Idaho social experience.

item.title: The Central Hub
item.description: In this gallery you can view the remodeled Hyrum Manwaring Center, originally constructed in 1966, and was rededicated in December 2010.

item.title: Celebrating Success
item.description: Each graduating class is unique and ready to spread their roots. View the Winter 2013 graduates.

item.title: Fall Activities and Events
item.description: There is never a dull moment at BYU-Idaho. View what the students and the community alike have participated in featured in this gallery.

item.title: Education Week
item.description: BYU-Idaho Education Week strengthens individuals and families through a variety of informative classes, inspired speakers, and fun-filled activities.

item.title: The Latest at BYU-Idaho
item.description: Here are a few of the latest news highlights, alumni events, and ways to stay connected with BYU-Idaho of the Spring 2013 semester.

item.title: Amazing Alumni
item.description: Meet alumni and learn what being a graduate of BYU-Idaho means to them and how you can get involved as an alumnus.

item.title: Extraordinary Possibilities
item.description: Student employment, internships, and student-led activities help BYU-Idaho students become extraordinary.

item.title: An Inspired Place
item.description: Watch this video to learn the history of BYU-Idaho, as well as the qualities that made it the spiritual stronghold it is today.

item.title: Uplifting Messages
item.description: In these worship services, held every Tuesday afternoon, students and employees come together to hear words of counsel and inspiration.

item.title: A Special Alumni Broadcast
item.description: Watch a special BYU-Idaho Alumni broadcast of President Kim B. Clark speaking about Pathway, where the program has been, and where it's headed.

item.title: Alumni Networking
item.description: BYU-Idaho alumni lend a helping hand by teaching the art of networking.

item.title: True at All Times
item.description: "I invite each one of us individually to recognize that how we disagree is a real measure of who we are and whether we truly follow the Savior." Elder Quentin L. Cook

item.title: Speaking Partners
item.description: A video about volunteering as a speaking partner for Pathway students.

item.title: Inspired Instructors
item.description: Just as individual brushstrokes of a painting come together to create a unified image, the individual experiences of teachers and students come together to create a BYU-Idaho graduate.

item.title: The Three Track System
item.description: BYU-Idaho's innovative three track system keeps students headed towards their academic goals.

item.title: A Semester of Devotion
item.description: View these devotional hightlights from the Winter 2013 devotionals.

item.title: Serving Valiantly
item.description: President Kim B. Clark reminds all of us to reach out to others in need.

item.title: Academic Discovery Center
item.description: The Academic Discovery Center provides students with counseling to achieve success in their academic and career plans.

item.title: Interdisciplinary Studies
item.description: The Interdisciplinary Studies degree allows students with specific career goals to combine more than one discipline to achieve work in their desired career.

item.title: Get Involved
item.description: Thousands of alumni and students are furthering their career goals, developing rewarding relationships, and making a difference by getting involved.

item.title: Part of the Legacy
item.description: Installed Spring 2012, Legacy Hall is a new addition in the Hyrum Manwaring Center. Learn more about BYU-Idaho's deep rooted legacy.

item.title: Noteworthy News
item.description: Here are some important updates from campus during the Winter 2013 semester.

item.title: Student Living
item.description: Students have a variety of affordable student housing options. In addition, they are being encouraged and taught to live gospel principles with their roommates.

item.title: Online Courses & Degrees
item.description: Renowned for innovation in learning, BYU-Idaho extends its classroom education to online students worldwide while keeping costs low. Many different online degrees are offered and options continue to grow.
